intro: Trixis ochroleuca f. incisa, commonly known as the narrow-leaf trixis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small yellow to orange flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and shrublands. The species is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its attractive foliage and flowers.
